item.title: 以色列-伊朗战争给迪拜和阿联酋的商业环境蒙上阴影
item.description: 在 6 月份以色列与伊朗的战争中断了销售之后，阿拉伯联合酋长国的商业状况在第二季度的最后阶段遭受了挫折。【原文：Business conditions in the United Arab Emirates suffered a setback in the closing stages of the second quarter after Israel’s war with Iran disrupted sales in June.】

item.title: 索尼克 "的创造者世嘉寻求在中国和东南亚的发展
item.description: 世嘉公司（Sega Corp. ）正与国际合作伙伴联手拓展亚洲市场，降低对日本市场的依赖。【原文：Sega Corp. is teaming up with international partners to expand in Asia and lower its reliance on the Japanese market.】

item.title: 全球多头债券再次面临交易员的严格审查
item.description: 超长期债券再次成为投资者的痛点，因为对财政支出的担忧使今年全球最不稳定的市场之一再次成为焦点。【原文：Ultra-long bonds are once again threatening to become a pain point for investors, as jitters over fiscal spending put one of the world’s most volatile markets this year back into the spotlight.】

item.title: ASML、SAP、Mistral 要求欧盟推迟启动人工智能法案规则
item.description: 包括 ASML Holding NV、SAP SE 和 Mistral AI 在内的欧洲公司呼吁欧盟暂停实施其具有里程碑意义的人工智能法规，因为它们认为该法规会危及欧洲大陆的人工智能雄心。【原文：European companies including ASML Holding NV, SAP SE, Mistral AI have called on the European Union to suspend the implementation of its landmark artificial intelligence regulation because they say it puts the continent’s AI ambitions at risk.】

item.title: 瑞士通胀率意外上升，令瑞士央行松了一口气
item.description: 瑞士 6 月份的消费者物价意外上涨，这给央行带来了喘息的机会，此前，瑞士消费者物价跌破零点，迫使央行结束了一段时间的正借贷成本。【原文：Swiss consumer prices unexpectedly rose in June, offering respite to the central bank after a dip below zero forced it to end a period of positive borrowing costs.】

item.title: 前 OpenAI 董事会成员质疑扎克伯格的人工智能招聘狂潮
item.description: 前 OpenAI 董事会成员、乔治敦大学安全与新兴技术中心战略总监海伦-托纳（Helen Toner）表示，Meta Platforms 公司用于招募顶尖人工智能人才的数百万美元预算可能无法保证成功。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc.’s lavish multimillion-dollar budget for recruiting top AI talent may not guarantee success, said Helen Toner, former OpenAI board member and director of strategy at Georgetown’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易战助推欧洲利用货币期权避险
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策造成了比往常更大的价格波动，欧洲企业财务人员越来越多地转向期权市场来对冲货币风险，这种方法比通常使用的方法成本更高。【原文：European corporate treasurers increasingly are turning to the options market to hedge currency exposure, a more costly method than typically used, as Donald Trump’s trade policies cause bigger-than-usual price swings.】

item.title: 风险加剧，世界银行认为泰国将采取更多宽松货币政策
item.description: 世界银行预计，在外部和国内不确定性不断增加的情况下，泰国今年的货币政策将 "更加宽松"，其中包括总理钦那瓦（Paetongtarn Shinawatra）被暂时停职的政治危机。【原文：The World Bank expects Thailand’s monetary stance to become “more accommodative” this year amid mounting external and domestic uncertainty, including a political crisis that’s seen the temporary suspension of Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra.】

item.title: 日本央行董事称暂时停止加息后将恢复加息
item.description: 日本央行董事会成员高田恒久（Hajime Takata）警告说，日本央行的加息周期将在 "只是 "暂时停顿之后重新开始，即使在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统威胁要对日本商品征收比之前吹嘘的还要高的关税，从而给经济前景蒙上阴影之后，他仍将保持鹰派基调。【原文：The Bank of Japan’s rate hike cycle will resume after “only” a temporary pause, Board Member Hajime Takata warned, keeping his hawkish tone even after President Donald Trump clouded the economic outlook by threatening to impose tariffs on Japanese goods even higher than those previously touted.】

item.title: AustralianSuper推进私募股权投资，四项新交易即将启动
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的养老基金澳大利亚储蓄基金（AustralianSuper）投资总监表示，该公司正在增加对非上市资产的配置，力争在年底前完成四笔私募股权交易。【原文：AustralianSuper is increasing its allocation to unlisted assets as the country’s biggest pension fund works to finalize four private equity deals by the end of the year, according to the firm’s investment chief.】
